intro: Pilosella arctogena, commonly known as the Arctic mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella arctogena is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
